com.scvngr.levelup.core.net.request

Class RequestUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scvngr.levelup.core.net.request.RequestUtils

  • @LevelUpApi(contract=INTERNAL)
public final class RequestUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with methods to help with creating requests.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String HEADER_ACCEPT
      Header key for the accepts.
      static java.lang.String HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE_JSON
      Value for the accepts header for JSON.
      static java.lang.String HEADER_DEVICE_MODEL_KEY
      Header key that maps to the model of the current device.
      static java.lang.String HEADER_DEVICE_MODEL_VALUE
      Header value representing the model of the current device.
      static java.lang.String HEADER_USER_AGENT
      Header key for the user agent.

      • getNestedParameterKey

        public static java.lang.String getNestedParameterKey(@NonNull
                                     java.lang.String outerParam,
                                     @NonNull
                                     java.lang.String innerParam)
        Method to create a nested parameter key. A nested parameter key looks like: "user[name]".
        Parameters:
        outerParam - the outer parameter name.
        innerParam - the inner parameter name.
        Returns:
        String formatted like a nested parameter key

      • getDefaultRequestHeaders

        @NonNull
public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getDefaultRequestHeaders(@NonNull
                                                                                Context context)
        Get the request headers for all API requests.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        Returns:
        the headers to add to the request.

      • getUserAgent

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String getUserAgent(@NonNull
                                    Context context)
        Returns a String representation to use as the User-Agent string when communicating with the server. A sample string looks like: "LevelUp/2.3.12 (Linux; U; Android; 1.0; generic_x86/sd_x86; en-US;) LevelUpSdk/0.0.1".
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        Returns:
        the user agent value.

      • getUserAgentAppVersionString

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String getUserAgentAppVersionString(@NonNull
                                                    Context context)
        Gets the name and version of the app for the user agent header. For example, "LevelUp/2.3.12".
        Parameters:
        context - the Application Context
        Returns:
        version of the app.

      • getUserAgentSdkVersionString

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String getUserAgentSdkVersionString(@NonNull
                                                    Context context)
        Gets the name and version of the SDK for the user agent header. For example, "LevelUpSdk/0.1".
        Parameters:
        context - the Application Context
        Returns:
        version of the SDK.

      • getDeviceId

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getDeviceId(@NonNull
                                    Context context)
        Gets the deviceId to add to the login/register requests.
        Parameters:
        context - the Application context.
        Returns:
        the deviceId or null if it couldn't be determined.
